verses.verse: He that is wounded<WH1795> in the stones, or has his privy<WH8212> member cut<WH3772> off, shall not enter<WH935> into the congregation<WH6951> of the LORD.<WH3068>

A bastard<WH4464> shall not enter<WH935> into the congregation<WH6951> of the LORD;<WH3068> even<WH1571> to his tenth<WH6224> generation<WH1755> shall he not enter<WH935> into the congregation<WH6951> of the LORD.<WH3068>

An Ammonite<WH5984> or Moabite<WH4125> shall not enter<WH935> into the congregation<WH6951> of the LORD;<WH3068> even<WH1571> to their tenth<WH6224> generation<WH1755> shall they not enter<WH935> into the congregation<WH6951> of the LORD<WH3068> for ever:<WH5769>

Because<WH5921> they met<WH6923> you not with bread<WH3899> and with water<WH4325> in the way,<WH1870> when you came<WH3318> forth<WH3318> out of Egypt;<WH4714> and because<WH834> they hired<WH7936> against<WH5921> you Balaam<WH1109> the son<WH1121> of Beor<WH1160> of Pethor<WH6604> of Mesopotamia,<WH763> to curse<WH7043> you.

Nevertheless the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430> would<WH14> not listen<WH8085> to Balaam;<WH1109> but the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430> turned<WH2015> the curse<WH7045> into a blessing<WH1293> to you, because<WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430> loved<WH157> you.
You shall not seek<WH1875> their peace<WH7965> nor their prosperity<WH2896> all<WH3605> your days<WH3117> for ever.<WH5769>
You shall not abhor<WH8581> an Edomite;<WH130> for he is your brother:<WH251> you shall not abhor<WH8581> an Egyptian;<WH4713> because<WH3588> you were<WH1961> a stranger<WH1616> in his land.<WH776>
The children<WH1121> that are begotten<WH3205> of them shall enter<WH935> into the congregation<WH6951> of the LORD<WH3068> in their third<WH7992> generation.<WH1755>
When<WH3588> the host<WH4264> goes<WH3318> forth<WH3318> against<WH5921> your enemies,<WH341> then keep<WH8104> you from every<WH3605> wicked<WH7451> thing.<WH1697>

If<WH3588> there be among you any man,<WH376> that is not clean<WH2889> by reason of uncleanness<WH7137> that chances<WH4745> him by night,<WH3915> then shall he go<WH3318> abroad<WH2351> out of the camp,<WH4264> he shall not come<WH935> within<WH8432> the camp:<WH4264>

But it shall be, when evening<WH6153> comes<WH6437> on, he shall wash<WH7364> himself with water:<WH4325> and when the sun<WH8121> is down,<WH935> he shall come<WH935> into<WH8432> the camp<WH4264> again.
You shall have<WH1961> a place<WH4725> also without<WH2351> the camp,<WH4264> where<WH8033> you shall go<WH3318> forth<WH3318> abroad:<WH2351>

And you shall have<WH1961> a paddle<WH3489> on your weapon;<WH240> and it shall be, when you will ease<WH3427> yourself abroad,<WH2351> you shall dig<WH2658> therewith, and shall turn<WH7725> back<WH7725> and cover<WH3680> that which comes<WH6627> from you:

For the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430> walks<WH1980> in the middle<WH7130> of your camp,<WH4264> to deliver<WH5337> you, and to give<WH5414> up your enemies<WH341> before<WH6440> you; therefore shall your camp<WH4264> be holy:<WH6918> that he see<WH7200> no<WH3808> unclean<WH6172> thing<WH1697> in you, and turn<WH7725> away from you.
You shall not deliver<WH5462> to his master<WH113> the servant<WH5650> which<WH834> is escaped<WH5337> from his master<WH113> to you:

He shall dwell<WH3427> with you, even among<WH7130> you, in that place<WH4725> which<WH834> he shall choose<WH977> in one<WH259> of your gates,<WH8179> where it likes<WH2896> him best:<WH2896> you shall not oppress<WH3238> him.
There shall be no<WH3808> whore<WH6948> of the daughters<WH1323> of Israel,<WH3478> nor<WH3808> a sodomite<WH6945> of the sons<WH1121> of Israel.<WH3478>

You shall not bring<WH935> the hire<WH868> of a whore,<WH2181> or the price<WH4242> of a dog,<WH3611> into the house<WH1004> of the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430> for any<WH3605> vow:<WH5088> for even<WH1571> both these are abomination<WH8441> to the LORD<WH3068> your God.<WH430>

You shall not lend<WH5391> on usury<WH5391> to your brother;<WH251> usury<WH5392> of money,<WH3701> usury<WH5392> of victuals,<WH400> usury<WH5392> of any<WH3605> thing<WH1697> that is lent<WH5391> on usury:<WH5391>

To a stranger<WH5237> you may lend<WH5391> on usury;<WH5391> but to your brother<WH251> you shall not lend<WH5391> on usury:<WH5391> that the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430> may bless<WH1288> you in all<WH3605> that you set<WH4916> your hand<WH3027> to in the land<WH776> where<WH834> <WH8033> you go<WH935> to possess<WH3423> it.

When<WH3588> you shall vow<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> to the LORD<WH3068> your God,<WH430> you shall not slack<WH309> to pay<WH7999> it: for the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430> will surely require<WH1875> it of you; and it would be sin<WH2399> in you.
But if<WH3588> you shall forbear<WH2308> to vow,<WH5088> it shall be no<WH3808> sin<WH2399> in you.

That which<WH834> is gone<WH4161> out of your lips<WH8193> you shall keep<WH8104> and perform;<WH6213> even a freewill<WH5071> offering, according as you have vowed<WH5087> to the LORD<WH3068> your God,<WH430> which you have promised<WH1696> with your mouth.<WH6310>

When<WH3588> you come<WH935> into your neighbor's<WH7453> vineyard,<WH3754> then you may eat<WH398> grapes<WH6025> your fill<WH7648> at your own pleasure;<WH5315> but you shall not put<WH5414> any in your vessel.<WH3627>

When<WH3588> you come<WH935> into the standing<WH7054> corn<WH7054> of your neighbor,<WH7453> then you may pluck<WH6998> the ears<WH4425> with your hand;<WH3027> but you shall not move<WH5130> a sickle<WH2770> to your neighbor's<WH7453> standing<WH7054> corn.<WH7054>
